---
title: "Italian Polls"
author: "Enxhi Buxheli"
date: "10/1/2018"
output: html_document
---

```{r setup, include=FALSE}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = FALSE)
library(tidyverse)
library(dplyr)
```

```{r, message = FALSE, warning=FALSE}
polling <- read_csv("italy_parliament_polls.csv")

polling %>%
  select(date, firm, FIPDLFI, IdV, LN, UdC) %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x = date, y = value, color = variable)) + 
    geom_point(aes(y = FIPDLFI, col = "FIPDLFI")) +
    geom_point(aes(y = IdV, col = "IdV")) +
    geom_point(aes(y = LN, col = "LN")) +
    geom_point(aes(y = UdC, col = "UdC"))
```

The purpose of this document is to show polling results in Italy.
